text:
I think this is so cool, I mean
none of our friends are here.

So we can be a real couple.
We don't have to hide.
I know. I can do this.
And I can do this.

- We can't do that.
- We can't do that.
Hey, Bing!
Whoa! Who's the pretty lady?

And what the hell
is she doing with you?

I ask myself
that very question, sir.

- This is Monica.
- This is my boss, Doug.

- Doug, this is Monica.
- Hi, nice to meet you.

- Hi. This is my wife, Kara.
- Nice to meet you, Monica.

- Bing!
- Okay.

Hey, uh, Bing,
did you hear about

the new law firm
we got working for us?

- No, sir.
- Yeah, do we cheat 'em and how?

Come on, honey, let's go
drink our body weight.

- What was that?
- What?

- That noise you just made?
- Oh, that was my work laugh.

- Your work laugh?
- Yeah, believe me.

If you're gonna
survive this party

you're gonna have
to come up with one too.

- Alright. Check me out.
- Okay.

He says, "$30, Father.
Same as in town."

Hey, everybody at work
loved you last night.

- Really?
- And they like me more..

...just because
I was with you.

I think you repaired
a lot of the damage
from when they met Joey.

And Doug wants us to
play tennis with him.

He's never even talked
to me outside of work.

Except for that time when
we bumped into each other
at that strip club.
Strip church.

Anyway, I'm gonna go try
to find a racket.

- Hey, I thought you had one.
- Oh, I used to.

But then Joey thought it'd be
fun to go to Central Perk
and hit rocks at..
...bigger rocks.

Well, I gotta
tell you, Bing

that partner of yours
is a real tiger.

Are you alright,
sweetheart?

We're just gonna get
a little sip of water.
Am I on fire today or what?

Those birds are browned,
basted and ready to be carved.

Listen, I think we should
let them win the next game.
- Are you crazy?

We own those two.
Look at 'em!

He can't even breathe,
and she's popping pills.

You're not even
giving them a chance.

They have rackets,
don't they?

Bing, I think we're gonna
make this the last game.

Oh, yes, sir.
Put me out of my misery.

Are you sure
you never played pro?
Please let them win.

I'll take it
down to 95 percent

but that's
the best I can do.

- Oopsie, missed it!
- I got it!
Nice shot.
I got it!
Long!

I can't believe
you let them win.

Yeah, well, at least you hid
your feelings well about it.

- I was frustrated.
- It was my racket.
I was frustrated with you!
If we hadn't lost the game

they would never have invited
us to dinner tomorrow night.

You know what
really bothers me?

It's how, how different
you act around them.

I mean, you know,
the throwing the tennis games

the fake laugh,
the "See you later, Bing!

Not if I see you
first, Doug!"

I gotta tell ya, I don't
like work-Chandler, okay.
The guy's a suck-up.

Okay, well, you know what?
Because you said that..
...I'm not putting out tonight!
